result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy David Casanova was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation today.  May petition the court for early discharge at 18 months if all other conditions are in compliance.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid thru Probation, failure to pay will be a judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge, failure to pay will be a judgment.

Not to have contact with: David Dumke unless requested via victim offender conferencing as directed thru Probation.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, failure to pay is a judgment.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Restitution to be held open for 30 days.

timeConds.notes:
Must serve 25 days & the remainder is banked for use by probation.  Subject to work release, no good time.  Must report to later than 9-5-2016.
May serve time in MN if there is no cost to Polk County.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy David Casanova

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy David Casanova in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 2:28 pm.  
Count 1-guilty.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  CT finds waiver of PSI.
SENTENCE:  w/h sentence, probation up to 5 yrs.  May petition for early discharge at 18 months if all other in compliance.  Must provide DNA sample.  $250 surcharge.  Restitution to be held open for 30 days.  120 days CT, serve 25 days & remainder is banked for use by probation, subj to WR no GT.  May serve time in MN if at no cost to Polk County.  Must report no later than 9/5/16.  $290.60.  No contact with David Dumke unless requested via victim offender conferencing as directed thru probation.  PCR.  Must report to probation today.  
No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
